titleStmt.title: Digital Edition of Glaser Abklatsch ID: AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-B61
AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-B61

encodingDesc.p: The original encoding was done in plain text files following the encoding quidelines of the Morgenländische Gesellschaft. With a dedicated web application these plain text files were transformed into XML documents validating (partially) against the Epidoc-Schema and those XML-Documents have been further sematically annotaded.
In order to avoid well known xml-issues especially in regards of overlapping elements the actual edited/annotated text was multiplied in several anonymos blocks, each block providing specific markup.

w-ḫryn-hmw bn nḍʿ w-šṣy šnʾm ḏ-rḥq w-ʿ.

1.[Ha]ʿān Yaʾzim and his sons Yaḥmad and Yaghbar, of the lineage of Samīʿum, 2.clients of Banū Bataʿ, have dedicated to their patron-god Taʾlab Riyāmum, 3.lord of Qādimān Dhū-Damhān (this) bull of bronze and (this) stone stele 4.in order that he (i.e. Taʾlab) might protect them and grant them luxuriant crops in 5.their terraced fields and their wādī-side plots; and (they have also dedicated) because Taʾlab Riyāmum saved 6.his servant Yaḥmad from the maladies from which he suffered (when he returned) from Sahrat= 7.ān and the land of Hawzān. And they praised the power and might of Taʾlab Ri= 8.yāmum, in order that he might grant them the good pleasure of their lords and their tribe, 9.and that he might protect them from the harm and enmity of any enemy far or [ne= 10.[ar]. And they praised Taʾlab on account of all the oracular responses which he rendered to them through his oracle. 11.And they praised Taʾlab because he enriched the yield 12.of their fields and their wādī-side plots. Now this dedication took place in the month of 13.Dathaʾ of the year of Saʿdʿathtar bin Ḥawfāʿathat, at the end of his term in eponymous office. And (they dedicated) because 14.he (i.e. Taʾlab) saved them from the land of Ḥimyar and the Arabs and from every military campaign 15.which they undertook, [and] because he granted his servant Yaḥmad two military 16.leaders whom he killed and stripped of possessions at ʿAthrib and Maʿlūlān, and because he saved him 17.from the battlefield of Ṭamḥān in Khayl. By Taʾlab Riyāmum.

And they praised the power and might of Taʾlab Ri= <lb n="8"/>yāmum, in order that he might grant them the good pleasure of their lords and their tribe, <lb n="9"/>and that he might protect them from the harm and enmity of any enemy far or <supplied reason="lost">ne= <lb n="10"/><supplied reason="lost">ar</supplied>. And they praised Taʾlab on account of all the oracular responses which he rendered to them through his oracle. <lb n="11"/>And they praised Taʾlab because he enriched the yield <lb n="12"/>of their fields and their wādī-side plots. Now this dedication took place in the month of <lb n="13"/>Dathaʾ of the year of Saʿdʿathtar bin Ḥawfāʿathat, at the end of his term in eponymous office. And <unclear>they dedicated</unclear> because <lb n="14"/>he <unclear>i.e. Taʾlab</unclear> saved them from the land of Ḥimyar and the Arabs and from every military campaign <lb n="15"/>which they undertook, <supplied reason="lost">and</supplied> because he granted his servant Yaḥmad two military <lb n="16"/>leaders whom he killed and stripped of possessions at ʿAthrib and Maʿlūlān, and because he saved him <lb n="17"/>from the battlefield of Ṭamḥān in Khayl. By Taʾlab Riyāmum.</ab>

div.tei:ab:
Haʿān Yaʾzim and his sons Yaḥmad and Yaghbar, of the lineage of Samīʿum,
clients of Banū Bataʿ, have dedicated to their patron-god Taʾlab Riyāmum,
lord of Qādimān Dhū-Damhān this bull of bronze and this stone stele
in order that he i.e. Taʾlab might protect them and grant them luxuriant crops in
their terraced fields and their wādī-side plots; and they have also dedicated because Taʾlab Riyāmum saved
his servant Yaḥmad from the maladies from which he suffered when he returned from Sahrat=
ān and the land of Hawzān. And they praised the power and might of Taʾlab Ri=
yāmum, in order that he might grant them the good pleasure of their lords and their tribe,
and that he might protect them from the harm and enmity of any enemy far or ne=
ar. And they praised Taʾlab on account of all the oracular responses which he rendered to them through his oracle.
And they praised Taʾlab because he enriched the yield
of their fields and their wādī-side plots. Now this dedication took place in the month of
Dathaʾ of the year of Saʿdʿathtar bin Ḥawfāʿathat, at the end of his term in eponymous office. And they dedicated because
he i.e. Taʾlab saved them from the land of Ḥimyar and the Arabs and from every military campaign
which they undertook, and because he granted his servant Yaḥmad two military
leaders whom he killed and stripped of possessions at ʿAthrib and Maʿlūlān, and because he saved him
from the battlefield of Ṭamḥān in Khayl. By Taʾlab Riyāmum.

Haʿān Yaʾzim and his sons Yaḥmad and Yaghbar, of the lineage of Samīʿum,
clients of Banū Bataʿ, have dedicated to their patron-god Taʾlab Riyāmum,
lord of Qādimān Dhū-Damhān this bull of bronze and this stone stele
in order that he i.e. Taʾlab might protect them and grant them luxuriant crops in
their terraced fields and their wādī-side plots; and they have also dedicated because Taʾlab Riyāmum saved
his servant Yaḥmad from the maladies from which he suffered when he returned from Sahrat=
ān and the land of Hawzān. And they praised the power and might of Taʾlab Ri=
yāmum, in order that he might grant them the good pleasure of their lords and their tribe,
and that he might protect them from the harm and enmity of any enemy far or ne=
ar. And they praised Taʾlab on account of all the oracular responses which he rendered to them through his oracle.
And they praised Taʾlab because he enriched the yield
of their fields and their wādī-side plots. Now this dedication took place in the month of
Dathaʾ of the year of Saʿdʿathtar bin Ḥawfāʿathat, at the end of his term in eponymous office. And they dedicated because
he i.e. Taʾlab saved them from the land of Ḥimyar and the Arabs and from every military campaign
which they undertook, and because he granted his servant Yaḥmad two military
leaders whom he killed and stripped of possessions at ʿAthrib and Maʿlūlān, and because he saved him
from the battlefield of Ṭamḥān in Khayl. By Taʾlab Riyāmum.
